author: mike.ferris
content: To clarify, we'll keep all discussions about the above in this channel

author: mike.ferris
content:
Ok so there's a few more CDAP people interested in working on the portal network components. How about we have a first "what the heck are we doing" open zoom next week. Everybody's welcome to join. I think the earlier in the week the better (I'm good for Monday), but here's a doodle poll that includes the whole week: https://doodle.com/poll/9nkmafpbxeaxsfca?utm_source=poll&utm_medium=link

Goal for this zoom is to get a sense for where each of us are at in terms of knowledge/experience/understanding around the portal network/ethereum in general, and get a rough plan for the work/research that needs to be done such that we can divvy it up and work in smaller groups.

<@!403199329520713728> <@!694014391288332358> <@!556982778684637185> <@!472419717970133002> <@!690224518383534174> 
And then it seems like <@!240180844130598912> and <@!436721623014572042> already have their projects scoped, but feel free to join.
Once it's scheduled I'll post the link so that any latecomers to this channel can join.

author: jacobkaufmann
content: Any way to make the poll more granular (e.g. by hour)? I have availability windows on each day, but it looks like I can either commit to the entire day or none of it

author: mike.ferris
content: my bad, i meant to make it granular by the hour. Let me see if I can fix it.

author: mike.ferris
content: Ok let's use this doodle poll instead: https://doodle.com/poll/9nkmafpbxeaxsfca?utm_source=poll&utm_medium=link

content: Now that I'm thinking about it, I set the hours to 9-5 EST which might not make a ton of sense for a lot of us.

author: ogenev
content: probably morning EST 9:00-12:00 is preferable  for Europe timezone

author: mike.ferris
content: Ok, what other timezones are we workin with here? It would be helpful to rule some out. I'm assuming we have some western US people, so 11 or 12 EST might be best for them

author: acolytec3
content: I'm not part of CDAP (instead on the EthereumJS team) but am interested in participating as life allows with the view of building out a JS/TS portal client (either as part of or alongside the main EthereumJS client).  I've been experimenting with chainsafe's implementation of discv5 and have gotten far enough to get a handshake succeeded with ddht and currently working to see if it'll say hi to fluffy.  I haven't done any deeper coding on it yet as I just jumped into this in the past week but will try to attend whatever time y'all pick as life allows

author: acolytec3
content: I'm EST for what it's worth

content: oooooh... I'm so excited to have you guys joining the party!

content: I'd temper your expectations until I make some better progress. I'm standing on the work of others so far üò¨ but we'll see how it goes
